availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Andrew Jackson "Jack" England (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Bath County native. Son of Jane England. Married to Margaret M. Snedegar England. Father of Anne W. England, Sarah J. England, Margaret F. England. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Served in the 40th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from September 29, 1863, to December 30, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 64B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Wyoming, p. 128A.
Vital Statistics Original Death Certificates – Microfilm (1911-1965), KDLA,Film 7017550: All Counties, Bath County, 1930, File #10255, p. 360 of 3309 of microfilm.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 438.
Find A Grave, “Andrew Jackson England (1836-1905)," Memorial # 51348787, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/51348787/andrew-jackson-england (accessed January 11, 2021).
